perturbation.original_text: Before starting any activities or operations under this Agreement, you agree to procure and maintain in full force and effect during the term of this Agreement (and for such period thereafter as is necessary to provide the coverages required under this Agreement for events having occurred during the Term of this Agreement), at your expense, at least the following insurance policy or policies in connection with the Franchised Business or other facilities on premises, or by reason of the construction, operation, or occupancy of the Franchised Business or other facilities on premises. Such policy or policies must be written by an insurance company or companies we have approved, having at all times a rating of at least "A-" in the most recent Key Rating Guide published by the A.M. Best Company (or another rating that we reasonably designate if A.M. Best Company no longer publishes the Key Rating Guide) and licensed and admitted to do business in the state in which the Franchised Business is located, and must include, at a minimum (except that we may reasonably specify additional coverages and higher policy limits for all franchisees periodically in the Manual or otherwise in writing to reflect inflation, identification of new risks, changes in the law or standards of liability, higher damage awards and other relevant changes in circumstances), the following:
perturbation.changed_text: Before starting any activities or operations under this Agreement, you agree to procure and maintain in full force and effect during the term of this Agreement (and for such period thereafter as is necessary to provide the coverages required under this Agreement for events having occurred during the Term of this Agreement), at your expense, the following insurance policy or policies in connection with the Franchised Business or other facilities on premises, or by reason of the construction, operation, or occupancy of the Franchised Business or other facilities on premises. Such policy or policies must be written by an insurance company or companies we have approved, and must include, at a minimum the following:
perturbation.explanation: The original clause ensures policies are up to standard by requiring companies with a rating of "A-" or better by A.M. Best and including a range of policies like liability, indemnity, auto, workers' comp, cyber, umbrella, and property insurance. The modified version allows for lower quality insurance companies and significantly reduces the liability coverage, creating a **legal contradiction** with state and federal laws that mandate specific insurance requirements and coverage levels for businesses and employees.
perturbation.contradicted_law: State and Federal Laws regarding Minimum Insurance Coverage Requirements

perturbation.original_text: All policies listed in Section 15.1 above (unless otherwise noted below) must contain such endorsements as will, periodically, be provided in the Manual. All policies must waive subrogation as between us (and our insurance carriers) and you (and your insurance carriers).
perturbation.changed_text: All policies listed in Section 15.1 above (unless otherwise noted below) may contain such endorsements. Policies may waive subrogation.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause mandates specific endorsements, detailed in the manual, and requires a waiver of subrogation, protecting both parties from claims against each other's insurers. The modified version makes these endorsements optional and weakens the subrogation waiver. This introduces a **legal risk** with potential conflicts with insurance regulations which often mandate specific endorsements for commercial policies and rely on subrogation waivers to allocate risk and prevent double recovery.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Insurance Regulations Regarding Endorsements and Subrogation

perturbation.original_text: At least thirty (30) days before the time you are first required to carry any insurance under this Agreement, and from then on, at least thirty (30) days before the expiration of any such policy, you agree to deliver to us certificates of insurance evidencing the proper coverage with limits not less than those required under this Agreement. All certificates must expressly provide that we will receive at least thirty (30) days' prior written notice if there is a material alteration to, cancellation, or non-renewal of the coverages evidenced by such certificates. Additional certificates evidencing the insurance required by Section 15.1 above must name us, and each of our affiliates, directors, agents, and employees, as additional insured parties, and must expressly provide that any interest of same therein will not be affected by any breach by you of any policy provisions for which such certificates evidence coverage.
perturbation.changed_text: You agree to deliver to us certificates of insurance. Certificates may provide notice. Certificates may name us.
perturbation.explanation: The original text requires delivering certificates 30 days before the policy start and renewal dates, mandatory 30-day written notice to the franchisor for any changes, and naming the franchisor as an additional insured party. The modified version makes providing certificates of insurance optional, the notice period not mandatory and the additional insured clause not required. This omission creates a **legal contradiction** with standard business practices and legal precedents for verifying insurance coverage and protecting involved parties.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General Business Practices and Legal Precedents Regarding Insurance Verification
